title: 113_s1463
content: The "Captive Primate Safety Act" adds nonhuman primates to the list of prohibited wildlife species under the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 are amended to include a new Captive Wildlife Offense, making it illegal to import, export, transport, sell, receive, acquire, or purchase captive wildlife. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 now prohibit the interstate or foreign commerce of live animals of prohibited wildlife species. This limitation does not apply to individuals who do not allow direct contact between the public and prohibited wildlife species. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit the interstate or foreign commerce of live animals listed in section 2(g), replacing it with "prohibited wildlife species." This restriction does not apply to individuals who prevent direct contact between the public and prohibited wildlife species. Amendments also replace instances of "animal" with "prohibited wildlife species" in certain clauses. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit the interstate or foreign commerce of live animals listed in section 2(g) as "prohibited wildlife species." Exceptions are made for individuals preventing direct contact with these species. Amendments also specify conditions for transporting nonhuman primates for assisting individuals with severe mobility impairments. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit interstate or foreign commerce of prohibited wildlife species, with exceptions for nonhuman primates transported by specially trained individuals from nonprofit organizations to permanently disabled individuals with severe mobility impairments. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 allow for the transportation of nonhuman primates by specially trained individuals from nonprofit organizations to permanently disabled individuals with severe mobility impairments, under certain conditions such as secure enclosure, no contact with other animals or the public, and compliance with state and local transport restrictions. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 update civil and criminal penalties, including inserting subsection (e) in various paragraphs. Effective date and regulations are also addressed. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 update penalties and regulations, with subsection (d) specifying the effective date and regulations to be implemented by the Secretary of the Interior within 180 days of enactment. The Captive Wildlife Safety Act is amended to remove subsection (b) and clarify regulations for implementation by the Secretary of the Interior.
